1.title: Largest Anime Conventions of 2016
1.plot: Has anime convention attendance plateaued? Find out which of the largest cons have had slower growth and which have declined in our annual look at the largest anime cons in the United States and Canada for the past year.

2.title: SacAnime Winter 2017 Report
2.plot: Sacramento's SacAnime kicks off our convention reports for 2017 with their winter edition.

3.title: Cosplay Help: Planning & Organization
3.plot: Get tips to plan your cosplay and be more organized with all your cosplay projects.

4.title: Panel Rejection
4.plot: Did your panel idea get rejected? Doug explains some common reasons and how to avoid being rejected next time.

5.title: January 2017 Feedback
5.plot: It's our first feedback episode of 2017 and we've got two months of stuff to catch up on.

6.title: LumaCon 2017 Report
6.plot: LumaCon returned for its third year and Patrick was there. Hear all about this great little con.

7.title: Cosplay Help: Masquerade Expectations
7.plot: It can be scary entering a costume contest for your first time. Elizabeth helps set your expectations so your cosplay can shine.

8.title: Gallifrey One 2017 Report
8.plot: Take a step into the TARDIS and hear all about Gallifrey One, the oldest Doctor Who convention in the US.

9.title: March 2017 Feedback
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: January 2009
1.plot: In our premiere episode, we review the ten largest anime cons of 2008 and help you figure out which convention to attend first.

2.title: February 2009
2.plot: This month Elizabeth shows you how to become an airport security disaster, Patrick gets confused and reports from a baseball convention, we tell you how to ditch your friends, plus news and upcoming conventions.

3.title: March 2009
3.plot: Elizabeth sets your expectations for anime conventions, we tell you how to go to a con on the cheap, Patrick makes waiting in line a little easier, plus news and upcoming conventions.

4.title: April/May 2009
4.plot: We introduce you the most annoying person in a panel, Shiva shows you how to make a better AMV, we give away some DVDs, plus news and upcoming conventions.

5.title: June 2009
5.plot: This month, Elizabeth shows us how awesome Anime Boston was, FUNimation leaves no con behind, and we find out what convention attendees think, plus news and upcoming conventions.

6.title: July 2009
6.plot: In our July edition, we check out PortConMaine, Elizabeth sits down with voice actor Greg Ayres, Patrick tells you how to get our con schedule into your calendar, plus news and upcoming conventions.

7.title: August 2009
7.plot: For our August episode, we talk with voice actor Tiffany Grant about her convention experiences, Elizabeth reviews Otakon 2009, Sketch talks about speaking Japanese at cons, plus news and upcoming conventions.

8.title: September 2009
8.plot: On a road trip to Dragon*Con, the AnimeCons.com crew bring you news from the world of anime conventions, an interview with voice actress Michele Knotz, answer a question about cosplay, plus a list of upcoming cons.

9.title: October 2009
9.plot: Doug makes his escape from New York Anime Festival in this month's episode while Elizabeth and Shiva tell you what's up with elevators. We also sit down with adorable actress Samantha Inoue-Harte. Of course, we also cover news and upcoming conventions.

10.title: November 2009
10.plot: Daniel Kevin Harrison talks about anime cons, Elizabeth reveals what to expect when watching or entering a masquerade, Doug rants about fans that suck, plus news and upcoming conventions.

11.title: December 2009
11.plot: The AnimeCons.com Holiday Special presents you with an interview with Svetlana Chmakova, small and large cons compared, the premiere of the Sailor Moon Stars dub, plus we look back at 2009.

1.title: January 2010
1.plot: It's time for the annual list of 2009's largest anime conventions in North America. Plus, we sit down with voice actor Bill Rogers, Doug tells us what to watch out for in weapons policies, and we share the latest news and upcoming cons.

2.title: February 2010
2.plot: Sketch and Elizabeth discuss prop making techniques, Shiva tells us the difference between masquerade and cosplay, Elizabeth shows us how to cook in our hotel rooms, and Anime Expo's staff retention troubles top our news stories.

3.title: March 2010
3.plot: Elizabeth and Shiva share advice for making a great masquerade skit while Patrick reminds convention planners what to put on their web sites. In the news, Final Fantasy composer Nobuo Uematsu makes his first North American convention appearance. We also take care of some Q&A and list upcoming conventions.

4.title: April 2010
4.plot: We talk about the pros and cons of stuffing a hotel room, share tips for planning a panel, and offer advice for a first time attendee.

5.title: May 2010
5.plot: Voice actor Christopher Ayres shares his experiences from anime conventions, we take a look at Anime Boston 2010, and Doug reflects on the passing of an anime legend, Carl Macek.

6.title: June 2010
6.plot: Sketch, our resident artist, talks about the differences between a dealers' room and artists' alley, Patrick explains why you should never start a convention, and we tackle a bunch of questions from a viewer.

7.title: July 2010
7.plot: We take a look at this year's AnimeNEXT and PortConMaine...and then turn their attendees against each other in Versus.

8.title: August 2010
8.plot: On this month's episode, we take a look back at ConnectiCon, "That Guy" returns to the show with cosplay photography, and Sketch offers more artists' alley advice.

9.title: September 2010
9.plot: Doug tests Otakon's EMT staff, Elizabeth helps cosplayers prepare for Judgement Day, and we get the inside double-scoop on what Doug really did at Otakon.

10.title: October 2010
10.plot: We talk about what we think makes Dragon*Con so good, Doug tells us about Anime Weekend Atlanta, Patrick shares his advice for booking guests, and AX needs a new CEO...again.

11.title: November 2010
11.plot: Doug returns to NYAF to see if they listened to his suggestions last year, we sit down with Kyle Hebert to talk about his convention experiences, Elizabeth tells you where to stuff your bags, and we want you at our first ever meet-up.

12.title: December 2010
12.plot: We get festive with the latest anime con news, Doug and Elizabeth talk about Anime USA, and we all sit down to reflect on 2010.

1.title: January 2011: Ten Largest Anime Cons of 2010 and Amy Howard Wilson
1.plot: The crew figures out the ten largest anime conventions of 2010, help you avoid being scammed when buying a costume, and talk with Nova from Starblazers, Amy Howard Wilson.

2.title: February 2011: The Future of Anime Conventions
2.plot: Elizabeth and Sketch talk about the newest guests at PortConMaine, Elizabeth and Patrick discuss the future of anime conventions, Elizabeth and Doug remind us of some tips when going to a con, and Shiva dives into our mailbag.

3.title: March 2011: Cosplay Drama and Panel Scheduling
3.plot: Elizabeth and Sketch talk about impending cosplay drama in LA, Patrick demonstrates successful panel scheduling and The Conventionist app, and we discuss how to kill time at a convention.

4.title: April 2011: Zenkaikon and Putting on Wigs
4.plot: We head down to Zenkaikon, show you how to put on a wig, and talk about what conventions are doing to help with Japan's disaster relief efforts. Plus, we get our first voice mails.

5.title: May 2011: Anime Boston 2011 and FUNimation
5.plot: It's time for another look at Anime Boston, we talk with Adam Sheehan about the new FUNimation web site, Patrick talks about the new features of our own web site, and Doug mourns Tokyopop.

6.title: June 2011: Hatsune Miku, Tom Wayland, and Cosplay
6.plot: Anime Expo announces a virtual guest, Tom Wayland gets interactive, and Elizabeth steers Doug in the right direction for cosplay.

7.title: July 2011: PortConMaine 2011 and Brian Brushwood
7.plot: We talk about Otakon's matsuri announcement, Doug experiences his first PortConMaine, and Shiva sits down with Brian Brushwood.

8.title: August 2011: ConnectiCon 2011 and Getting There by Plane
8.plot: We talk about delays and staffing needs at ConnectiCon 2011, discuss if a convention is responsible for the outside action of attendees, give tips for traveling to a con by plane, Sketch gets a fan, and we give away a smartphone.

9.title: September 2011: Otakon 2011 and Jim Kaposztas
9.plot: Doug and Elizabeth talk about Otakon 2011, we interview Jim Kaposztas, the inventor of AMVs, make a promo video and win an Android phone, and we get a really sweet voice mail.

10.title: October 2011: J. Michael Tatum and Tips for Buying a Wig
10.plot: J. Michael Tatum tells which of his characters he thinks he could cosplay, Shiva and Elizabeth give advice on buying a wig, Patrick talks about how fans saved Greg Ayres's smile, and there's not much time left to enter our contest.

11.title: November 2011: Blizzcon 2011 and Charles Dunbar
11.plot: Patrick returns to Blizzcon, Doug talks with Charles Dunbar, we discuss if VIP badges are worth it, and we give away a free Android phone.

12.title: December 2011: Roland Kelts and the Year in Review
12.plot: To close out 2011, we visited Anime USA, talked with author Roland Kelts, and looked back on our favorite moments of the convention year.

1.title: January 2012: Ten Largest Anime Cons of 2011 and Geoff Tebbetts
1.plot: It's time for our annual list of the ten largest anime cons, Patrick explains why no news is good news, and Doug sits down with anime blogger Geoff Tebbetts.

2.title: February 2012: FanCons.com and an AWO Interview
2.plot: AnimeCons.com is expanding with FanCons.com, we talk with Daryl and Gerald from Anime World Order, and Elizabeth puts together a cosplay repair kit.

3.title: March 2012: Katsucon 2012, Handling Press, and Versus!
3.plot: Elizabeth and Doug talk about their visit to Katsucon, Patrick offers suggestions for handling press at your convention, and Versus is back and we take on The Chibi Project.

4.title: April 2012: Programming for Mature Attendees and Our First Conventions
4.plot: Anime conventions aren't just for kids. We discuss what programming is good for grown-ups. Each of us talks about our first time at a convention. Also, we announce a contest where you can win a copy of Cat Planet Cuties.

5.title: May 2012: Anime Boston's Tenth Year and Coloring Eyebrows for Cosplay
5.plot: We have extended coverage of Anime Boston's tenth year with a con report and interviews with attendees. Also, Shiva and Elizabeth demonstrate how to color your eyebrows for cosplay.

6.title: June 2012: Programming for Grown-Ups, Boston's Matsuri, and Cosplay Groups
6.plot: Do conventions need more adult programming that's not porn? Plus, Shiva and Sketch visit a matsuri festival and Shiva and Elizabeth talk about cosplay groups.

7.title: July 2012: AnimeNEXT, PortConMaine, and Con Plague
7.plot: Did AnimeNEXT adequately prepare for lines? Was PortConMaine hot and "in-tents"? How can you avoid the dreaded CON PLAGUE? Find out on AnimeCons TV.

8.title: August 2012: ConnectiCon, Don't Be That Guy, and Our Biggest Fan
8.plot: Patrick and Elizabeth talk about some issues at ConnectiCon, "That Guy" is back and in your hotel room, and Sketch talks to our biggest fan.

9.title: September 2012: AnimeIowa, Otakon, and Gathering Feedback
9.plot: Three con reviews this month as Patrick talks about AnimeIowa, Doug and Elizabeth discuss Otakon, and a caller tells us about Godaikocon. Plus, we offer suggestions on how staff can best collect feedback from attendees.

10.title: October 2012: Ed Chavez, Cosplay Procrastination, and Apps at Cons
10.plot: We finally talk about cosplay procrastination, Doug sits down with Vertical, Inc's Ed Chavez, and we take a look at some helpful apps to use at conventions.

11.title: November 2012: Mike Toole, Meeting Guests, and the Off Season
11.plot: Doug and Sketch talk about what to do in the downtime between cons, Patrick and Shiva talk about how to approach guests, and we talk with anime columnist Mike Toole.

12.title: December 2012: Nekocon, Bakuretsu Con, and 2012 Year in Review
12.plot: It's time for our annual year in review. We also talk about two friendly conventions, Nekocon and Bakuretsu Con.

1.title: Ten Largest Anime Conventions of 2012
1.plot: Patrick and Sketch run down the list of the largest anime conventions in North America during 2012. This is the first of our weekly episodes.

3.title: 50th Episode
3.plot: We started this podcast in 2009 and now we've hit our 50th episode. To celebrate, we're sharing our favorite moments, giving our fans a studio tour, and sharing a ton of funny bloopers.

4.title: January 2013 Feedback
4.plot: Now that we're weekly, we're going to answer your voice mails, e-mails, carrier pigeon, and other feedback and do housekeeping once a month. Also, we share poll results and upcoming conventions.

5.title: Submitting Conventions to AnimeCons.Com and FanCons.Com
5.plot: Patrick gives details and advice for submitting new conventions to the AnimeCons.com and FanCons.com database.

6.title: Prop Talk with Sculpey
6.plot: Sketch talks about the different kinds of Sculpey, their advantages and disadvantages, and how they can be used to make a wide variety of cosplay props.

7.title: Balancing Real Life and Conventions
7.plot: Doug and Elizabeth discuss the delicate balance between your real life and your con life. How can you balance your hobby with your job, school, and family? Sometimes sacrifices have to be made.

8.title: February 2013 Feedback
8.plot: It's time again for our monthly feedback episode. We talk about Otakon Vegas, share poll results, and present a list of upcoming conventions.

9.title: Katsucon 2013
9.plot: AnimeCons TV invaded Katsucon in Washington DC for the convention's 19th year. Shiva, Gale, and Elizabeth talk about the con and then Sketch and Gale talk with some Katsucon attendees.

10.title: Gallifrey One 2013
10.plot: In a FanCons.com Special Report, Patrick tells us all about a Doctor Who convention, Gallifrey One. Also, there may be a Dalek singing karaoke.

11.title: Prop Talk with Worbla
11.plot: Shiva and Sketch reveal the secrets of working with Worbla. Learn how to use it to make great cosplay armor.

12.title: March 2013 Feedback
12.plot: It's time again for our monthly feedback episode. We share viewer mail, share poll results, and present a list of upcoming conventions.

13.title: Mystery Science Podcast 4000
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

14.title: Zenkaikon 2013
14.plot: Doug returns to Zenkaikon and is overwhelmed by the food options available to him. What else did he like? Watch and find out.

15.title: Funimation Goes After a Con with Bootlegs
15.plot: Funimation has filed legal action against Miller Isaiah Timmons of Animeland. We discuss why it took this long and what it means for other conventions.

16.title: April 2013 Feedback
16.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

48.title: 2013 Year in Review
48.plot: The entire podcast crew reunites once again to discuss the good and bad of the 2013 convention year.

1.title: Ten Largest Anime Conventions of 2013
1.plot: Patrick runs down AnimeCons.com's list of the ten largest anime conventions in North America in 2013.

2.title: SacAnime Winter 2014
2.plot: Shannon Morse (from Hak5 and Threatwire) joins Patrick as they discuss their trip to SacAnime in Sacramento, CA.

3.title: Otakon Vegas 2014
3.plot: Otakon recently tried their luck with a spin-off convention in the city of sin. Doug tells us if what happens in Baltimore worked in Vegas.

4.title: January 2014 Feedback
4.plot: For the first time in 2014, we dip into our voice mails and e-mails. Plus, we share upcoming conventions for the next couple months.

5.title: 100th Episode
5.plot: After five years, we've hit 100 episodes. Join us as we look back at the changes in the last five years and share some bloopers. Featuring messages from Kyle Hebert, Svetlana Chmakova, Bill Rogers, and Brian Brushwood.

6.title: AOD 2014
6.plot: AOD 2014 took place in San Francisco this January. Patrick checked out the con to see what they had going on and reports from the convention.

7.title: Frederik L. Schodt Interview
7.plot: At Otakon Vegas, Doug sat down with Frederik L. Schodt, famed translator, interpreter and writer. Hear what the noted Tezuka translator and author has to say about anime conventions.

8.title: February 2014 Feedback
8.plot: We've got lots of feedback from you this month, so we'll answer your questions and present a list of anime conventions through April.

9.title: Katsucon 2014
9.plot: Sketch and Shiva braved a severe snowstorm to report from Katsucon 2014. Watch to find out if their 12 hour car ride paid off.

10.title: Gallifrey One 2014
10.plot: Gallifrey One is one of the best conventions in the world for Doctor Who fans. Patrick visited it again for its 25th timey-wimey year.

11.title: Cosplay Help: Bias Tape
11.plot: All about bias tape. Learn how to use single and double-sided bias tape, different methods to sew it on, and how to make your own bias tape.

12.title: March 2014 Feedback
12.plot: We've got a viewer report from Katsucon. Also, are body pillows a good way to make your start in artists' alley? Find out in our latest feedback episode.

13.title: Anime Boston 2014
13.plot: Shiva and Sketch have returned from another year at Anime Boston. How well did the staff handle over 25,000 attendees? Watch and find out.

14.title: Spring Kraken Con 2014
14.plot: Kraken Con is back again in Oakland, California. This one-day con saw 50% growth since their last con in October, so they've got to be doing something right. Watch and find out why it's so good.

15.title: Finding Conventions Near You
15.plot: Patrick Delahanty, the creator of AnimeCons.com, walks you through the process of finding, tracking, and rating conventions.

16.title: April 2014 Feedback
16.plot: It's time for monthly feedback with reports from PAX East 2014, questions about planning for a panel, and what to do about sex offenders.

17.title: Planning for a Panel
17.plot: Doug and Elizabeth offer some helpful advice to anyone thinking about running their first panel at a convention.

18.title: User Suggestions for AnimeCons.Com
18.plot: This week, it's not podcast feedback...it's web site feedback. Patrick reviews suggestions people have made for AnimeCons.com.

19.title: Riki LeCotey Interview
19.plot: Patrick sits down with Riki LeCotey, star of Heroes of Cosplay, to talk about cons from long ago and what's coming up on the show this season.

20.title: May 2014 Feedback
20.plot: E-mail, Twitter, and YouTube comments, and a video from Movie Phone Guy are all part of this month's feedback.

21.title: Big Wow ComicFest 2014
21.plot: Patrick returns to Big Wow ComicFest in San Jose, California to see how they've expanded since his visit last year.

22.title: Anime Central 2014
22.plot: DJM, Brandon Cooper, and Petey Rave talk about their time at Anime Central 2014.

23.title: Cosplay Help: Organizing Everything
23.plot: Get tips from Shiva for sorting and storing your cosplay items and supplies. Learn how to properly store everything to save space, stay organized, and even save money.

24.title: June 2014 Feedback
24.plot: Viewer-submitted con reports on Anime Boston, AnimeNEXT, and Colossalcon are the bulk of our feedback this month.

25.title: PortConMaine 2014
25.plot: Patrick steps down from staffing PortConMaine so that he finally gets to tell everyone what he likes about the con. Do you want to go to PortCon?

26.title: Exhibiting in Artists' Alley
26.plot: Svetlana Chmakova, author of Dramacon and Nightschool, has a discussion with Melissa McCommon, author of "Epic Chaos", about organizing successful sketch jams at conventions, redrawing one's comic one too many times, and exhibiting in the artists' alley.

27.title: Anime Expo 2014
27.plot: Anime Expo 2014 was the largest anime convention in the US. Doug reports from the front lines...and there were apparently A LOT of lines.

28.title: July 2014 Feedback
28.plot: Was there a live action Attack on Titan? Does Florida need another con? All this and more in our July feedback episode.

29.title: Nerdtacular 2014
29.plot: Put your Frogpants on and learn what happened at Nerdtacular in Snowbird, Utah and why it might be the best con ever.

30.title: Red Flags of Bad Conventions
30.plot: Not every convention is a resounding success. Patrick Delahanty shares tips from his 15+ years of conventions to teach you how to spot the potential red flags of bad conventions before you get trapped at one.

31.title: Convention Survival Skills
31.plot: Recorded at ConnectiCon 2009, Patrick and Elizabeth share some essential convention survival skills.

32.title: August 2014 Feedback
32.plot: Lots of people weighed in on our Red Flags of Bad Conventions episode; plus, the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge.

33.title: Otakon 2014
33.plot: Doug and Charles report back from Otakon 2014 with details on the registration line, panels, and concerts.

34.title: Cosplay Help: Interfacing
34.plot: What is interfacing and how to do use it? Shiva demonstrates how to make a bow using interfacing.

35.title: Tony Oliver Interview
35.plot: Voice actor Tony Oliver sits down with Doug at Otakon 2014 to tell us about his first convention experience and share his thoughts on conventions.

36.title: September 2014 Feedback
36.plot: Doug's back this week to respond to your feedback and let you know what we've got coming up in the next few months.

37.title: Post-Con Depression
37.plot: Do you get down in the dumps after getting home from a convention? You may suffer from PCD: Post-Con Depression. Learn what causes it, how to avoid it, and how you can recover from PCD.

38.title: Cosplay Help: Sewing Patterns: Part 1
38.plot: Elizabeth has some helpful advice for using sewing patterns when making your next costume. Learn how you can find the right pattern, get big discounts, size the pattern correctly, and use patterns to your advantage.

39.title: Fall Kraken Con 2014
39.plot: Six months later, Patrick returns to Kraken Con for their 2-day fall edition. Find out what changed and how the convention handled expanding to a second day.

40.title: October 2014 Feedback
40.plot: Elizabeth responds to comments and tweets in this month's feedback episode and gives a preview of upcoming episodes.

41.title: SNAFU Con 2014
41.plot: Patrick visits SNAFU Con 2014 in Reno, Nevada. Does the convention live up to its name? Watch and find out.

42.title: Staffing a Convention
42.plot: What is involved in staffing a convention? Doug and Patrick answer some frequently asked questions.

43.title: Cosplay Help: Sewing Patterns: Part 2
43.plot: Sewing pattern instructions continue with Elizabeth's second installment. Learn to use patterns to make Gadget.

44.title: November 2014 Feedback
44.plot: Sketch is joined by Ooga Booga to respond to the questions and comments sent in to AnimeCons TV by our viewers.

45.title: Gift Ideas for Cosplayers
45.plot: Looking for gift ideas for your cosplayer friends? Elizabeth has plenty of great gift suggestions.

46.title: Helpful Apps to Have at Conventions
46.plot: These apps will help make your convention experience easier and they're all free.

47.title: Best of 2014
47.plot: We've compiled our con reports, interviews, and other special moments into one episode that tells the tale of our con experiences for 2014.

48.title: 2014 Year in Review
48.plot: The entire podcast crew reunites once again to discuss the good and bad of the 2014 convention year.

1.title: Ten Largest Anime Conventions of 2014
1.plot: It's time for AnimeCons.com's annual list of the ten largest anime conventions in North America in 2014.

2.title: SacAnime Winter 2015
2.plot: The winter edition of SacAnime took place last weekend and we returned to kick the year off with this Sacramento anime con.

3.title: Writing a Successful Panel Application
3.plot: Are you thinking of doing a panel at a convention? You'll have to apply and get the convention to accept your panel among potentially hundreds of other submissions. Not everyone's panel gets accepted. Doug shares some tips for writing a good panel application that has a greater chance to get accepted.

4.title: January 2015 Feedback
4.plot: Elizabeth shares some YouTube, Twitter, and voice mail feedback from AnimeCons TV fans.

5.title: Peter Cullen Interview
5.plot: Transform and roll out for our interview with the legendary Peter Cullen, the voice of Optimus Prime.

6.title: AOD 2015
6.plot: We return to AOD at the Hyatt SFO in San Francisco to see what improvements they've made since last year.

48.title: 2015 Year in Review
48.plot: The entire AnimeCons TV team looks back on the good, the bad, and the ugly from the 2015 convention year.

1.title: Ten Largest Anime Conventions of 2015
1.plot: It's time for AnimeCons.com's annual list of the ten largest anime conventions in North America in 2015.

2.title: Sac-Anime Winter 2016 Report
2.plot: Starting the new year off with a con, we headed to Sac-Anime Winter 2016 in Sacramento, CA.

3.title: Staff Talk: Being a Nice Staffer
3.plot: Doug shares some advice on communicating with attendees and being a nicer convention staff member.

4.title: January 2016 Feedback
4.plot: Our first monthly feedback episode of 2016 features a lot of comments on the Ten Largest Anime Cons of 2015.

5.title: LumaCon 2016 Report
5.plot: You've never heard of LumaCon and will probably never attend it, but Patrick explains why it's a wonderful idea in this FanCons.com Special Report.

6.title: Cosplay Help: Craftsmanship Judging
6.plot: If you enter a cosplay competition at a con, you might sign up for craftsmanship judging. Elizabeth walks you through the process and lets you know what to expect.

7.title: Staff Talk: Social Media for Conventions
7.plot: Learn the essentials of getting your convention on social media. Patrick explains where you need to be and how to sign up.

8.title: February 2016 Feedback
8.plot: Doug responds to our latest feedback and kicks off a hunt for the world's first anime music video.

9.title: Making an Episode
9.plot: For our 200th episode, we go behind the scenes and show you the making of a typical episode.

10.title: Artists' Alley: The Plan (Revised)
10.plot: Svetlana revises her plan for artists' alley based upon her recent convention appearances.

11.title: Staff Talk: Panel Scheduling
11.plot: Patrick shares his surprisingly easy analog technique for successful panel scheduling.

12.title: March 2016 Feedback
12.plot: Elizabeth responds to questions and comments we've received over the last month and talks about what's coming up on AnimeCons TV.

13.title: Anime Boston 2016 Report
13.plot: The largest anime con in the northeast, Anime Boston, was held over Easter weekend and Elizabeth has a full report.

15.title: Bangor Comic & Toy Con 2016 Report
15.plot: Reuben (aka "Movie Phone Guy") explores Bangor Comic and Toy Con in Bangor, Maine and talks with attendees.

16.title: April 2016 Feedback
16.plot: Patrick responds to the previous four weeks of feedback from the show floor at Kraken Con Spring 2016, plus some news about some of the AnimeCons TV cast.

17.title: Spring Kraken Con 2016 Report
17.plot: It's time for Kraken Con once again and Patrick is joined by Hak5's Shannon Morse to talk about the Bay Area's best fan convention.

18.title: Cosplay Help: Worbla Wrapping
18.plot: Make amazing looking cosplay props by wrapping a mold in Worbla. Sketch walks you through his process.

19.title: Anime Fan Fest 2016 Report
19.plot: It's a new anime convention in a familiar facility. Charles and Doug share their thoughts on Anime Fan Fest 2016.

20.title: May 2016 Feedback
20.plot: Sketch and Shiva respond to your comments and questions from May 2016.

21.title: Cosplay Help: Makeup
21.plot: Elizabeth demonstrates makeup application tips for a couple different looks.

22.title: Cosplay Help: Staying Cool in Costume
22.plot: Want to be cool like Doug? He's got some tips on how to avoid heat exhaustion in your costume.

23.title: Wizard World
23.plot: You've probably been tempted by a Wizard World convention. Is it worth it? No. Watch to find out why.

24.title: June 2016 Feedback
24.plot: "Anime" cons that aren't anime cons, getting a hotel room at age 17, and a 6-foot Pikachu? All that and more.

25.title: PortConMaine 2016 Report
25.plot: PortConMaine never disappoints and this year they outdid themselves by expanding to reduce overcrowding.

26.title: Cosplay Help: Zippers: Part 2
26.plot: Most costumes need zippers of some kind even if they're invisible, so Elizabeth demonstrates how to sew in an invisible zipper.

27.title: What to Do at Boring Conventions
27.plot: Don't sit bored at a con. There's plenty of other stuff to do even if the con itself is boring. Don't just sit and mope in your hotel room.

28.title: July 2016 Feedback
28.plot: Questions, comments, and corrections - We received a record amount of feedback from our fans.

29.title: Going to Cons on the Cheap
29.plot: Conventions can be expensive to attend, but Sketch, Elizabeth, and Patrick have some great tips on how you can pay less to go to a con...and maybe even attend for free.

30.title: Kin-Yoobi Con 2016 Report
30.plot: Kin-Yoobi Con is a small one-day anime con in the San Francisco Bay area. Patrick headed down to check it out and bring you this report.

31.title: Cosplay Help: Thibra
31.plot: Thibra is a new thermoplastic which can be used by cosplayers as an alternative to Worbla and WonderFlex to create armor, props, and other solid objects as part of a costume. It only needs an activation temperature of 160°F to become pliable. Elizabeth experiments with Thibra and puts it to the test with heating and attaching.

32.title: Otakon 2016 Report
32.plot: It's Otakon's final year in Baltimore before moving to DC. Doug and Charles discuss their experiences.

33.title: August 2016 Feedback
33.plot: This month's feedback episode discusses feedback at cons, Kin-Yoobi Con's history, and much more.

34.title: Pokémon Voice Actors Interview
34.plot: We sat down for an exclusive interview at Otakon 2016 with five Pokémon voice actors, Sarah Natochenny, Lisa Ortiz, Haven Paschall, Alyson Leigh Rosenfeld, and Michael Liscio Jr., to talk about conventions.

35.title: SacAnime Summer 2016 Report
35.plot: SacAnime Summer 2016 took place on Labor Day weekend in Sacramento, CA. Patrick and Shannon headed up to check it out.

36.title: Cosplay Help: Hot Glue Tricks
36.plot: Hot glue is for more than sticking things together. Elizabeth shares some tricks to create details on your costume using hot glue.

37.title: September 2016 Feedback
37.plot: Shiva and Sketch respond to this month's questions and comments. Should you start a new con? NO.

38.title: Wine Country Comic Con and Santa Rosa Toy & Comic Con
38.plot: We went to two feuding conventions on the same day. Find out what the deal is with Wine Country Comic Con and Santa Rosa Toy and Comic Con and which one won the day.

39.title: Panel Tech
39.plot: Be prepared for whatever tech a convention may have for your panel. Doug recommends what to do to be ready for any situation.

40.title: Sailor Moon Exhibition
40.plot: The Sailor Moon Exhibition took place in Tokyo this year. Get an inside look at the exclusive event.

41.title: October 2016 Feedback
41.plot: Advice for some artists as Svetlana Chmakova hosts this month's feedback episode.

42.title: Another Anime Con 2016 Report
42.plot: Another anime con by the name of Another Anime Con was recently held in Manchester, NH and Movie Phone Guy was there to report back to us.

43.title: BlizzCon 2016 Report
43.plot: Fans of Overwatch, World of Warcraft, Diablo III, Heroes of the Storm, Starcraft II, and Hearthstone flocked to the 10th BlizzCon in Anaheim.

44.title: November 2016 Feedback
44.plot: Elizabeth responds to our final feedback of 2016 and explains how to get a list of cons on your Amazon Echo.

45.title: Fall Kraken Con 2016 Report
45.plot: Our final con report of 2016 is from the fall edition of Kraken Con in Oakland, California. It was as great as ever, but there's no spring edition in 2017? Watch and find out why.

46.title: 2016 & 2017 Predictions
46.plot: It's time to review our 2016 convention predictions and make new ones for 2017.

47.title: Best of 2016
47.plot: We've compiled our con reports, interviews, and other special moments into one episode that tells the tale of our con experiences for 2016.

48.title: 2016 Year in Review
48.plot: The entire AnimeCons TV team looks back on the good, the bad, and the ugly from the 2016 convention year.

-1.title: Malie Flanagan Interview
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.
